result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel S. Wagner
Current: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 09-02-2022)
Prior: 1212 S 11th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220
RE: Maintain drug trafficking place, on 08-31-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of maintain drug trafficking place, possess drug paraphernalia and possess Methamphetamine.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-06-22 at 3:00 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that have no contact with Tessie Wells, Anthony Brey, Tyler Hoffman and Jolene Wagner.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
